comments:
Build M9.

Sorry, another NPE without precise recreation steps.  If you don't want to be 
bothered, no problem, I understand.  The only information I have is the 
attached error log.  It occurs several times when the focus changes from the 
Schema editor.

I'm unable to reproduce this one too :(

SchemaPropertySheet.selectionChanged(part, selection) calls
super.selectionChanged(part, selection) per the stack trace below.  I've tried
shoving variations of part = null and selection = null into selectionChanged in
SchemaPropertySheet and they're handled gracefully.  

Thus, I'm going to ask that this bug be reassigned to Platform UI for a null
check in PropertySheetEntry.refreshChildEntries() if possible.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at
org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.PropertySheetEntry.refreshChildEntries(PropertySheetEntry.java:436)
at
org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.PropertySheetEntry.setValues(PropertySheetEntry.java:627)
at
org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.PropertySheetViewer.setInput(PropertySheetViewer.java:805)
at
org.eclipse.ui.views.properties.PropertySheetPage.selectionChanged(PropertySheetPage.java:370)
at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.schema.SchemaPropertySheet.selectionChanged(SchemaPropertySheet.java:97)
at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.PDEMultiPagePropertySheet.selectionChanged(PDEMultiPagePropertySheet.java:96)

Created an attachment (id=11335)
ClassCastException error log

Another related exception, indicating a problem in
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.editor.schema.SchemaObjectPropertySource.

Dan, Please enter a separate bug report for the ClassCastException and assign 
it to PDE/UI.  You can reference this bug report in the PDE one if you like.
Opened bug #64988, marked class cast exception log obsolete.

Not for 3.0.

Based on where the NPE happens, it looks like one of the property descriptors
has a null id.  Can you have a look at your property source to see if this can
happen?
In this case, it may be a regression from Bug 53035's suggested fix. :(

Took out the suggested fix from Bug 53035 so this should clear up problems here.

Nick, feel free to close this bug. :-)
Dan, if it happens again, please let me know.

Thanks!
